review_title: Low salary for the amount of work
pros: The University of Manitoba has a nice campus (although it is very far from the city center and all activities).
cons:
The faculty salaries are not competitive with similar universities. 
The administration refuses to negotiate in a meaningful way with the University of Manitoba Faculty Association (UMFA). There is more respect for instructors and technical staff (who earn almost as much as faculty members). 
Winnipeg is a cold city. The University of Manitoba is run by locals who don't seem to want to make it a truelly international university.

review_title: PhD funding and awards in engineering
pros:
1) The faculty of engineering is wealthier than other departments
2) There are many engineering awards available for M.Sc. and Ph.D. students
cons:
1) Long winters (~6-7 months) with freezing cold weather
2) Engineering awards and scholarships are not fairly distributed in the faculty of engineering. Don't get crazy, if you see someone with no publications getting engineering awards each year, while you receive no award with 4 publications in prestigious journals.
3) Range of studentships depend on the level of generosity of the professors.
4) Unlike other provinces, healthcare is not for everyone in this province. International students must pay to insure themselves.
5) Tuitions are increased annually.

review_title: Newer employee, so far so good!
pros: Work life balance, very minimal stress, great pay and benefits are bar none. The managers I work with are willing to listen and are adaptable to change. They don't know an answer, willing to accept and learn. University offers days where you can participate in different events, planting, volunteering, luncheons. Also education reimbursement is available for certain programs at 100% and 50% at others. My staff seem content and there is way less turn around than my last workplace, which means our employees are more knowledgeable in their positions.
cons: The education/training initiatives are not as clear as they could be so I don't think many people take advantage of it. They also don't offer many extended education courses at the University, and courses outside the university are only covered at 50% to a max of $900 per year. Still better than any other work place I have been at.

review_title: Equality and Recognition for Women in Research fields
pros: It's a smaller university but with many faculties and departments for variety of opportunities. It has great rates at it's fitness facility for staff, students and alumni.
cons: It's the only option for post-graduate research related work in the Province, leaving little options to do research at such a level in any other place in the province. Lack of funding, scholarships, especially for women in science & engineering fields.  Politics interfering with research. Lack of support and gender imbalance. It is located in the south end of the city, and makes transportation time consuming and congested, since the city doesn't have a rapid transit system. So unless you have a greater reason to live in Winnipeg, it is often difficult to attract people top notch people who demand the best support systems for it's employees.

pros: Scenic campus adjacent to Red River. Close commute for myself from nearby residential area. Wide diversity of disciplines of which some have off-campus research sites. Average quality of instruction and research. Recent new buildings and new recreation centre.
cons: Poor pay for research associates and postdoctoral researchers. Poor benefits and lack of upward mobility. Limited opportunity for permanent career. Limited support for linking graduates and employers. Hires spouse recruits with neither advertisement nor competition for the position. Difficult to gain access to the research laboratory during times of commercial stadium usage due to traffic jams and parking issues. Not very bike friendly.

review_title: Look elsewhere or use a stepping stone.
pros: Nice campus and plenty of places to walk during your lunch hour.  The benefits package is fairly decent but negotiations are reducing it every year. Professional people working in IT.
cons: Management attitude in the IT department (IST) is to build a culture of fear. There's little to no respect for the skills and effort required to keep the IT systems running or and limited respect for the knowledge required to build them. Pay is low compared to similar jobs elsewhere and there's a concerted effort by management to reduce the classifications of all IT staff. The Human Resources department is an adversary rather than helping you be better at your job. Training budget is extremely limited so training and career related conferences are difficult to impossible to obtain.

review_title: High pay for low stress employment.
pros: The University of Manitoba pays well for the work you do, and has a good benefits program. You also have a lot of chances for career advancement, and there are a lot of options for career advisement as well. If you can get on the daycare list early (~2 years before needed) the daycare is one of the best in the city, and is extremely convenient. Parking is relatively cheap, and even better, buses are frequent from most areas of the city (although it is a long trip from the north end).  Also, the U of M is a well-respected employer, so it looks great on any resume.
cons:
Not enough hours for TA's and Sessional Instructors.
Not the best food options (on-campus).

job_title: PhD Student and RA in Winnipeg, MB
pros: As a graduate student in UM, you can access lots of education resource on the condition of approval of your supervisor.  You could have lots of your own time. Enjoy good summer time and took vacations as you want.
cons: Most professors in this university stop doing research once they got tenure position. And the old pros took the position of faculty and they are not retiring...And it will lead to poor research production.  If you dedicated to research, do not come here. If you do not want to do research, there is no reason to come here.  I graduated six month ago, still looking for research jobs...

pros: It is a highly reputable and established educational institution with a long track record of promoting learning in a diverse range of subject areas. One is proud to be associated with a university like this, the oldest and largest in Manitoba.
cons: Too much political correctness, "edubabble", and office politics; indecisiveness and lack of leadership on the part of middle management, in which there has been some turnover resulting in abrupt changes in direction, cancellation of courses, etc.

review_title: Great job security, you can do no wrong, but that can impact moral, and profesional developement
pros: Great Benefits, unmatched Job security.  Enjoy being apart of new building construction projects, and improving the maintenance systems by supporting the trade shops.
cons: Union environment breeds an entitlement attitude, moral is affected.  Not as flexible to create new positions or change processes, as all decisions are impacted by annual budgets.

review_title: I have been there for fifteen years.
pros: People are friendly and helpful. You can move around to different departments and faculties.  Promotion from within. Good benefits and good salary. Variety of positions.
cons: Right now the University is trying to streamline the whole university. Which means their are layoffs. That's is stressful to deal with.

review_title: Very good opportunities for administrative staff
pros: Excellent benefits, competitive salaries, potential for growth.
cons: Experience is largely dependent on the department and manager you work for. Managers can change every few years, which means administrative staff remain the constants in the equation and are responsible for maintaining knowledge and training of policies and procedures. Constant amount of organizational change which can be very stressful for employees.

pros: Good place to work. Very nice people and team works. Good balance between work and life. Very competitive benefit package. 2 Weeks holiday during Xmas.
cons: No fixed deadline for most projects. Everything is delayed. Most supporting research projects are based on finding which means you could probably loose your job within next few years if there is no funding to support the research.

review_title:
Wonderful place to work!
Have access to top notch instruments and valuable help in  molecular biology techniques
pros: Free seminars to get new information where you get to enjoy coffee and donuts while having the time to network with others
cons: Long hours when performing certain experiments so that having a coffee break or lunch can be challenging if working alone

review_title: Dept of Computer Science is great
pros: Benefits are good; beautiful campus has everything you need in one place; very friendly department with relatively laid back atmosphere
cons: Lots of bureaucracy, as you would expect, can make getting anything done, or improving a process, a time consuming and sometimes frustrating path. Some departments or faculties have strict dress codes and expectations of behavior.

review_title: Great job security, however, the politics get in the way of progress in the way of research.
pros: Good benefits, good working hours, friendly work environment.
cons: Staff members gradually form clicks and this can disrupt the work environment. There is way too much red tape/paperwork that has to be done just to purchase simple items such as a desktop or laptop computer for research purposes. Also, there is zero accountability.

review_title: Research assistant to professor - pretty good part time job
pros: It allows for flexible work hours, work from home, constant feedback from professor, work and study at the same place, interesting materials that often are related to the school materials.
cons: It's not a full time job and won't pay for all the bills. Sometimes, when there's deadline in class, there's a deadline to hand in some research results… stressful.

review_title: Good opportunities for hard working students
pros:
Great part time opportunities for undergraduate students to work as teaching assistants or graders.
Tunnel connects entire campus helping to stay warm in winter months
cons:
Hours for teaching assistants and graders are pre allocated and may sometimes be exceeded
Inter departmental communication could be better

pros: World class cutting edge research. Highly motivated Research scholars, Humble and Reachable Professors, Amicable administrative staff  which is the holy trinity for having the best atmosphere for all round development of students.
cons: Not particularly anything I can think of but yes there were some rats intruding into the building complex but that's not the Deans fault.

pros: Great to work with the professors and the pace of work is laid back. There is usually no pressure as you would expect to find in a traditional work-place.
cons: There are really no cons because you get to learn stuff that is useful for your graduate research, and go for conferences all over the world, as such broadening your prospects.

pros: Flexible hours and a lot of autonomy. Your experience will depend highly on the Principal Investigator of the lab and their management style.
cons: The hourly pay as a research assistant is dependant on the grant funding of the lab.

pros:
Lots of freedom to customize the delivery of the program within the eLearning platform provided.
Very helpful staff willing to assist when needed.
cons: eLearning platform in use at that time was clunky and slow making it frustrating to work with.

job_title: Information Technology Specialist in Winnipeg, MB
pros:
- Good working environment
- Excellent benefits
- Good work & life balance
- You get to meet and interact with a lot of people; both  students and staffs
cons: - Room for improvement with their approach and processes on how to handle major incidents within the IT and/or Engineering environments. They are getting there.

review_title: University of Manitoba- Undergraduate Research Assistant
job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Winnipeg, MB
pros: Employment at the University of Manitoba provides useful experience for students to gain more experience in fields of interest. Professors provide guidance and interesting projects for students to learn from while completing novel research.
cons: The pay varies between different labs, but many only pay minimum wage for work that requires specialized knowledge.

review_title: An inefficient place that hires too many inefficient people.
pros:
1. Convenience
2. Low cost of living in Winnipeg
3. It doesn't take long to figure out how things work at the UofM.
cons:
1. Very bureaucratic place
2. Inefficiency is blossoming at the UofM 
3. There is lack of transparency in decision making process

job_title: Graduate Research Student in Winnipeg, MB
pros: With a great supervisor you can have an amazing graduate student experience here, campus is nice and the work hours are flexible.  You need to be self motivated
cons: Payroll consistently messes up payments and expects that these missed payments, overpayments, and underpayments will be shouldered by students and not complained about.

pros: The working atmosphere is very good, faculty of graduate studies are supportive; students are friendly; there are activities to gather students together
cons: The funding is not very high; some buildings are old; sometimes it is a lot of work to do, but it depends on different cases

review_title: Great Place to be a Student Researcher
job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Winnipeg, MB
pros: Working as an undergraduate research assistant at the U of M provides young professionals with invaluable field and laboratory skills while exposing them to some of the latest innovative research in their fields.
cons: Employment can be largely based on one's ability to receive grants.

job_title: Mobile Applications Developer in Winnipeg, MB
pros: Relaxed work environment. No pressure from management or tight deadlines.
cons: Project team was very small, sometimes only one person was working on the project at a time.

review_title: Flexible work for hectic school schedules
pros: Shifts work with your classes so you only work when you have time
cons: pay is poor and hours are hard to get

pros: Wonderful Part time position for students. Especially for international students. Good working wage as well. Had a good experience with them.
cons: Few working shift hours. Instead of the 4 hour evening working shift, perhaps 5 would have been better I guess.

pros: Hands on experience aiding students with their laboratory experiments, great pay. 10/10 would hire
cons: the only downside that i experience is that it is a 2 hour bus ride away from my house.

review_title: Office Admin in Department of computer science
pros: Good pay, great co-workers. Beautiful location especially in the summer. The community is actively working to be good stewards of natural resources
cons: Beaurocracy, lots of detailed policies to be aware of.

job_title: Soil Science Technician in Winnipeg, MB
pros: If you are someone who enjoys a relaxed pace work with results oriented , not production oriented work this is a great place to work for you
cons: It is difficult to get permanent positions

pros: Very flexible schedule, good pay and great benefits for full time. Great people to work with. Lots of room for career advancement.
cons: No benefits for part time, not a lot of room to pick up shifts.

review_title: Great place for life science related research
job_title: Graduate Research Student in Winnipeg, MB
pros: Nice environment for working , especially for the graduate students
cons: The weather in Manitoba is pretty extreme. other than that the University is a great place for the graduate students

pros: It was good to teach students from various backgrounds. Helped a lot in improving technical skills
cons: Extra work ! But still it was enjoyable !

pros: almost friendly environment and you can find some good people working there
cons: low salary- you need connection for everything

pros: My supervisor is a very good person and his research quality is excellent
cons: Low wages compared to other good universities

pros: I am working for University of Manitoba for almost 1 year now as a web developer. They have a very good management team
cons: Compensation package is not up to the mark.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Winnipeg, MB
pros:

- Helpful advisors

cons:

pros: This employer helped me shape my life when I was a newcomer to Canada
cons: The fact that this job was part time.

pros: Push carts hard for 15 minutes and then get the rest of the hour off
cons: Pushing carts from one building to another

review_title: Good place to work; very collegial
pros: Very collegial and supportive colleagues.
cons: Pay is much lower than other equivalent Canadian Universities.

Infrastructure

Career development

Personality Development

pros: Reasonable tuition, availability of scholarships depends on the department
cons: The pay is usually fairly low and you have to pay tuition out of it

pros: None. I absolutely loved this job
cons: I loved this part-time position because of great flexibility, nice environment and obviously, working with students is always great

review_title: Great place to work if you get into the right area. Good benefits!

pros: Decent facility for working as a review manager.
cons: Too much politics. Do not allow to submit for grant applications.

pros: good gym, cheap tuition fee

pros: Gym, Between Christmas and New Years the University shuts down - great for employees with families, Benefits

review_title: Nice opportunity to acquire experience in teaching
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Winnipeg, MB

review_title: Great place to work, nice people
job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Winnipeg, MB

pros: Great working environment, flexible working hours, excellent lab facilities
